Text: Well, well, if it isn't Meteion's friend. Your learning is coming along well, I trust?
Well now, what an adorable familiar you are. Who might your master be, I wonder.
Between you and me, Hermes's eating habits are atrocious. We may not be reliant upon food to the extent that our smaller creations are, but our diets eventually catch up with us.
If we don't consume the requisite balance of nutrients, we grow weak and lethargic. Yet Hermes consumes candied apples as if they were a staple...
With the first commander otherwise engaged, it falls to me to lead the Temple Knights stationed here in Ishgard, while providing support for Lord Aymeric.

What ho, my good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>fellow</If>! We certainly had the most remarkable of adventures in Garlemald, which I've been explaining in great detail to Honoroit ever since my return. I only wish he could've been there with us!
I pray that Lord Emmanellain is able to acquit himself to the best of his abilities─meager though they may be.
Lord Emmanellain's spell of absence afforded me time to return to my writing. I must admit that life was rather duller without him, though not necessarily for the worse...
ObjectParameter(1), ,1)>, old girlboy! When I saw you off in the Ragnarok, I had every faith that you would return...and here you are! A more dependable comrade a man could not hope for!
I would love to show you around, but the Forum has us busy as an anthill. Things will have quietened down by the time the lift is returned to normal service, though. I'm sure of it.
Well, if it isn't our determined visitor! Contrary to what I'd hoped, the exodus has us busier now than we were before. My apologies, but that tour will have to wait...
I must admit, your long-eared friend is not what I expected when the Forum spoke of lunar collaborators.
But rabbit-shaped or not, anyone who can set aside their distaste of lemons to enjoy a lemon muffin is obviously a creature of higher sensibilities. Wouldn't you agree?
First with the reorganization, and then with the exodus, it's been one long order list after another...
Now that I have a little time on my hands, though, I think I'll use it to whip up a treat for our Loporrit friends. One basket of lemon muffins, coming up!
There's no end to the work we're required to do for the exodus. Even so, we must remember to rest, as I am now. These are not the sort of tasks you can perform while half-asleep.
Thank you for your concern, but I'm quite all right. Nothing a brief rest won't solve, at any rate.
I don't mean to sound pessimistic, but we've done all we can. The rest is up to you and yours. I suppose I could try praying for your success, though.
There are no words to express my gratitude for all you've done. Although our preparations for the great exodus were ultimately for nothing, I honestly don't care. I'm just happy to be alive!
Without the aetherburner working to the required capacity, we will be forced to make some very difficult decisions...
I hear you're cooperating with Master Kokkol to improve the aetherburner. Normally, he'd be reluctant to accept help from anyone, but now's not the time for stubbornness.
After all that time preparing the ark, they let you lot borrow it for an entirely different purpose? Far be it from me to question the wisdom of the Forum, but it seems bloody daft to me.
You've saved us from embarking on the great exodus and leaving our beautiful world behind. I was a fool for ever doubting you.
I wonder how a rabbit got in here... And why would anyone put a hat on it?
Apparently, the rabbit I saw was one of our lunar collaborators! I don't know what I was expecting, but it certainly wasn't that!
It's my job to prepare suitable living conditions on the moon, but I'd rather stay here, if at all possible.
I know there's no need for us to go to the moon now, but I'd still like to visit, just out of curiosity!
I wonder what this place is actually for...
Knowing the Forum, even the people working down here are probably kept in the dark about the true purpose of this place...
The further underground we go, the more surprises we find.
On our journey here, I was filled with an inexplicable sense of elation to see vegetables other than carrots being cultivated. Why, it near brought a tear to mine eye...
We must be close to the Central Circuit, which is where Sharlayan's greatest secrets are held...if the tomes I perused told the whole story.
The fields we passed along the way brought back memories...of Ferndale. Unfortunately, we were never blessed with such abundant crops.
Oh, there you are. Having words with Master Fourchenault, by any chance?
The Loporrits have told me of your victory over Meteion. It is a relief to know Hydaelyn's wish for Etheirys and Her people was granted.
She is not here to revel in your victory, but so long as there is life on Etheirys, Her spirit shall live on.
In the soothing summer rains, and gentle spring breezes, She will be with you always.
If you think I'll let you show me up with that little display at the harbor, think again! I'll make the most powerful aetherburner you've ever seen.
...Also, thanks for the adamantite!
This was fun, wasn't it? The pressure, the excitement...and none of you died! Turned out quite well, I'd say.
When we were installin' the hyperhopper, the Loporrits agreed to teach me some of their starfarin' ways. Soon, I'll be able to create an even blastier propulsion system!
...Once I get the Forum to part with some coin, that is. Starship parts ain't cheap.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! We heard you've been busy of late. I hope you manage to find a moment's respite before duty comes calling again.
Coultenet and I were just discussing what more we can do to help. If anything should come to mind, please don't hesitate to ask.
Tataru, Hoary, and I continue to do what we can to keep our brothers- and sisters-in-arms abreast of emergencies as they unfold.
They are ready to take action at a moment's notice, but I pray we have no need to call them to the fray.
You too have found yourself idle, my friend?
If you seek to occupy your time until the ark is ready, you needn't go far. Even the markets here in Sharlayan are filled with the most wondrous of sights.
Hm...? No, I am not neglecting my duties. Honestly, am I not allowed even a moment to myself? A genius needs time to reflect on his thoughts, you know.

The ark truly is a marvel, and I count myself fortunate having had the opportunity help build it. A pity I did not come here sooner. Oh, the things I could have done with the fruits of their research...
Not that that is any of your business, mind you. Though I suppose I could have found a way to apply that knowledge to further improvements to the ark, as well.
I have made my position quite clear. Do not test my patience.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, you came! Words cannot express how glad I am to see you!
We've just begun our work here with the contingent and local volunteers. Our foremost priority is establishing the number of survivors and distributing vital supplies.
As we continue our efforts, we will ensure that everything is done in consultation with the Garlean people. This is their nation, after all, and theirs must be the hands that steer its course.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, guess what! Just the other day, I tended to a beast terrorizing the station area, and afterwards a family came and thanked me!
And on another occasion, soldiers of the Ist Legion taught me about the medicine they use. It's unlike anything I've seen in Eorzea!
It's not all uplifting tales, of course, but every day I'm afforded the opportunity to grow. If only it weren't so cold all the time...
I didn't expect to see the twins in Garlemald again. Like you, they risked life and limb to save the world, and some would say they've earned a lifetime of peace and quiet. Yet here they are...
When they said that they wished to help us, they truly meant it. And if even outsiders haven't given up on us, then how could we possibly give up on ourselves?
The road to recovery will be long and hard, but we'll spare no effort. We'll rebuild Garlemald into a nation that all can be proud of. For those who are still here as well as those who couldn't be.

Oh, 'tis you. Rest assured all is well here. Slowly but surely, we work to restore normalcy in the wake of the exodus. There is much to be done─to discuss and decide─but it is a labor to cherish, afforded us by your victory.
Once again, permit me to express my gratitude for your valorous deeds. Not only as a member of the Forum, but simply as a parent.

As much as they have grown and proven themselves, I ask that you continue watching over my children. See that they do not engage in anything needlessly reckless─I fear my heart cannot take much more...
Ah, fancy meeting you here. Come to look in on the starship, have you?
I must say, it already feels like an age ago that we enhanced the vessel's aetherburner and then rode it forth unto the great unknown.
Sometimes, I find myself gazing up at the starry sky, wondering if it was all just a dream. Once behind you, even the grandest adventures become but a memory...
Well, well... I know not what errand bringeth thee hither, but thine is ever a welcome presence.

There being no inherent urgency to begin our wanderings, Thancred and I did decide to first see how fareth the discussions between the Forum and the Loporrits and, should it be necessary, lend our aid.

In exploring the uses of the moon and ventures beyond the star, soon or late, other parties will inevitably seek to be involved. We must needs ensure that the tendrils of dark designs are not permitted to wend their way into this endeavor.

If it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! How have you been feeling? No dizziness or nausea or some ailment or other after the journey? In particular, if you're having hallucinations, it may mean that an alien life-form has taken over your brain, and invasive surgery will be required to remove it.
...That was a jest. Did you like it? Urianger says it's useful for building rapport with you people.

Anyway, you may have heard that I'll be staying on Etheirys for a while. We're exploring all sorts of ways to make use of the moon, which means we're going to need to establish regular flights there and back!
Well now, have you come to check on Master Matoya? How very thoughtful of you.

She appreciates your visits, even though she would never admit it. Despite her years, she remains as indefatigable as ever. To hear her tell it, she means to cite abandonment and claim the Antitower as private property.
For my part, I'm glad to see you too. I'm only here until I find the tome I'm after in the library, so your timing couldn't be better.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, I didn't know you were in Sharlayan! You'll be staying awhile, I hope?

Lest you wonder, we've yet to receive a commission of note, and it hasn't been terribly exciting. The past few days have been mind-numbingly dull, in fact─Krile has me sorting endless stacks of tomes...

I'm still working through them at the moment, but perhaps later we can go and have a meal together? I should like to hear about your recent adventures...and of course I'd be more than amenable to embarking on one together!
Oh, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, how good of you to visit! As you can see, there is little change with us. Just pushing steadily along with our work.
A typical day involves tending to our commissions, sorting research materials, and liaising with collaborators. It doesn't sound like much, but it keeps the few of us here busy.
And few as we are, we've been able to keep your chamber as it is. If ever you need a place to rest your weary head, you're welcome to use it─Ojika, for one, would be pleased!
You're here too? I thought I would've moved on by now, but Vrtra hasn't deigned to reveal the details of his request yet. So here I still am.
But I can't complain. I have my own chambers and am being well looked after. Too well, even...
I can't help but suspect that they're softening me up for an especially bothersome task. Still, the food is excellent...
No need to explain─I have a rough idea what happened while I was...gone.

It was a strange feeling. As though I was struggling in a pitch-black sea. A powerful tide was trying to wash me away─one that churned with hatred and envy for life─and it was all I could do to swim against it. Then suddenly I was here.
It felt long and short at the same time. Hazy as in a dream. But through it all, one thing was crystal clear: you fought with all your being to keep our hopes alive.
To go and see all those places and more... Emet-Selch has given you quite a task.
Suffice it to say, I should be glad to assist you. Once we've returned together triumphant, of course.
For all the lives on those stars whose light hath been extinguished─for the ancients who went before us─I offer a solemn prayer...
I can't claim I fully understood the workings of this place. But in that moment, I felt I knew what I needed to do.
I felt that it was the right time to offer up this life I owe. That I could risk it all on the wager that the rest of you would manage without me.
Full glad am I to see that I was right.
As different and mysterious as the ancients may be, they were people not unlike us.
The first people to fall and feel pain. And the first forced to find a way to rise again.
From them we have come, and in our pain and suffering, we are connected.
'Tis my fervent hope that our ancient friends will find a new beginning─they and all of their brethren who have returned to the aetherial sea.
For that to come to pass, we must succeed. We must avert the Final Days and save Etheirys.
You think you've caught me? This form is barely a drop from the ocean that swells within the dead sun.
Even so, I could easily unmake you. You are only still alive because of your comrades. But they cannot protect you forever.
Until they fade away, I'll satisfy myself with watching you try─and fail─to find a way out of this lifeless place.
The skies, they...they no longer burn. I know not how, but the calamity that befell us has been averted.
It will take time for us to rebuild, and even then, life may never return to what it once was. So much has been lost...
But our hardships only make us stronger. That we yet live is a gift, and I will not see it squandered.
Oh, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! It is wonderful to see you, but perhaps now is not the best time for you to be here.
The other alchemists have been searching for you. They've come to understand your penchant for manipulating akasa, and they wish to run tests...
I'd rather you not be subjected to their ceaseless poking and prodding...unless you want to, of course.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! How good of you to come. Would you care for a cup of tea, or perhaps a light snack? ...No?
Just as well. I've no doubt there is yet much for you to do, as Alphinaud's letters would attest. He writes more frequently than ever these days.
Much to my surprise and delight, Fourchenault actually reads his letters now, albeit always with furrowed brow. He knows Alphinaud will be fine, but much like me, he cannot help but worry.
Ryne has told me about the Final Days. Though it pains me that we cannot aid you directly, at the very least, we can ensure that we are not a burden.
Should the destruction reach us, we will be prepared. So pray do not worry about us, and think only of your own task.
Feo Ul has brought the joyous tidings─the Final Days are averted!
You have saved our world yet again, and all the way from your own. No words will suffice to express our gratitude...but thank you. From the bottom of my heart.
Please take care─you and everyone. When next I see Ryne, I will let her know that you graced us with a visit.
...What's that? Has there been anything strange...aside from the fact that I've warmed to people?
Oh, spare me your japes! I merely engage in a fair exchange, as well you should know!
But to answer your question─no, I can't think of anything in particular. That you should ask such a thing, however... You aren't hiding something, are you?
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! To think that you were hiding something so enormous as the potential end of all life!
For your deceit, I should give you a piece of my mind...but I understand that you meant well.
Therefore, as fitting payment for seeing you hale and whole, I will overlook it this once. Now, off with you before I change my mind!
The Scions had the help of many souls in gathering refined adamantite, did you not? Even those who were not part of the Ilsabard contingent...
Perhaps there's an opportunity there. I shall speak to Mistress Tataru posthaste!
Please browse my exhibit at your leisure. Each and every piece has been lovingly crafted in honor of the Rising.
I'm pleased to present the works of J'bhen Tia, the brightest new star in the world of glass art. His artistry and craftsmanship will astound and inspire you!
As I mentioned, I shall remain here in Revenant's Toll while we await developments. If there are any tidings, rest assured I will let you know.
This place is truly amazing─an absolute boon for my research! What interesting tidbits I learn, I will be certain to share with everyone!
Oh, and you may have noticed...but there are little critters about the place.
Based on your accounts, I suspect they are vessels for the gods. Alas, they flee whenever I attempt to go near...
Greetings and salutations, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>my lady<Else/>my lord</If>. May this, the year of the rabbit, be an auspicious one for you and yours.

I am the usagi bugyo, and I lead a Far Eastern delegation on a mission to strengthen the bonds of friendship with the people of Eorzea. Let us share in the celebration of Heavensturn together, and learn what we may from one another.

Word of the omikuji has spread, and we have you to thank for it. Should you find yourself with a moment to spare, please speak with the omikujishi to see if there is anything else you can assist him with.
It is a pleasure to see you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>my lady<Else/>my lord</If>. Please accept my sincerest thanks for your assistance with the incident involving the pair of adventurers earlier.
Should you wish to partake in drawing lots, you may do so at any time whilst the festivities continue by speaking with the omikujishi.

This is by far the nicest set of armor I've ever owned. It is a work of remarkable craftsmanship, forged using techniques known only to master artisans of the Far East. The folks at the Armorers' Guild nearly turned green with envy when I showed it to them.
The omikujishi's words from earlier still ring in my head─of turning a curse into a blessing. Misfortune into fortune. It was a valuable lesson I shall not soon forget.
Beaudefoin's new set of armor suits him rather well, don't you think? He's certainly earned it─I couldn't ask for a finer comrade to have by my side.

Well, well, well, if it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Just moments ago, a man calling himself the mochi daikan handed me a curious cake made from rice. It had an oddly soft and chewy texture. You know, I think it would go quite well with pudding!
I am thrilled to see one and all enjoying the omikuji so. Though our cultures be different, it is wonderful that we can still come together in celebration like this year after year.

Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Madam<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. My apologies if I came off a tad forceful earlier─it was simply imperative that you meet with Lady Ameliance. I understand you were kind enough to accept her request, and for that, you have my gratitude.

As for Miss Miladeen, please rest assured that she is in good hands. She's only just arrived, yet her nervous energy and scrupulous manners have only endeared her to all of the servants─myself included. I don't believe I'm alone in thinking the manor feels different with her here already.

I hope the outfit was to your liking? All of us─Lady Ameliance included─wove it with the utmost love and care. For all your deeds, we owe you a debt that can never be repaid, but it is our wish that the outfit, in some capacity, acts as a semblance of our appreciation.
As for how things are here, the mansion simply hasn't felt the same since Miss Miladeen returned home. Much like Lady Ameliance, I too anxiously await the day she returns!
How wonderful it is to see the townspeople savoring our Hatching–tide confections! It heartens me to know that all the time I spent perfecting the recipe was not in vain.
And Master Pawlin's chickens are laying exquisite eggs for us one after the next. Why, we can scarcely keep up in decorating them all!
It may look effortless to the untrained eye, but I'll have you know that laying eggs places no small amount of stress on these birds.
That's why I'm thrilled to see not a single one go to waste. The yolks baked into toothsome treats, the shells painted into delightful ornaments─my little darlings can truly be proud!
\\<sniff> \\<squeak>♪
The happy bunny appears quite satisfied with itself, no doubt pleased to have contributed to the festivities in its own small way.
Cluck...cluck!
The chicken looks you intently in the eye, as if to say it trusts you to treat its precious eggs with care.
Long has it been since I journeyed to the realms of men. I must find one of strength, that might stand with us against the impending calamity...
Well, if it is not <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Genbu had hinted to me that our paths would cross again, but I did not expect it would be so soon.
Yes, ever since we became one, I have been having more and more of these...premonitions. Most of them are less than auspicious, so let it suffice to say that this one was most welcome.
And yet, intriguingly, this is not the future I foresaw. And so I must conclude that we are destined to meet again. Under what circumstances, I know not for sure─but I look forward to that day.
Whatever am I doing in this place? And here I swore I would have naught to do with men after he was lost to us.
Finally...you have come. How long has it been since we met outside the temple?
If you are wondering why I would make this journey so far to the West, it is simple─I had a vision that a little red sparrow and a mewling white kitten went off to visit you without me.
Dream or reality, I swore that I would not suffer such ignominy. And so I have come to claim you for myself. Yes, soon we shall settle the score of who is most worthy to stand at your side...
How precious─and how fragile─are the lives of men. I must endeavor to quell my aramitama, lest I unwittingly visit upon them a terrible fate...
We meet again...and to think it would be in a place like this. I must say, the customs of your land are most fascinating.
Were Tenzen here, no doubt he would have mistaken those two-legged rabbits for auspices, and attempted to recruit them into our ranks.

Speaking of which, have you met the others yet? If not, 'twould be best if you hurried along in search of them. Were they to find out that I had kept you all to myself, I fear for how their aramitama might respond...
Would that I had been stronger that day... Then he might still be here to partake in these festivities at my side...
I am most pleased─if not surprised─to find you here. After all, Tenzen, too, quite enjoyed festivals...and the two of you are alike in so many other ways.
I had meant to come alone, but my fellow auspices insisted on coming along for the ride─and quite literally, at that. Just look how my plumage has been ruffled by their clinging paws...
And yet, were Tenzen here, no doubt he would have gently reminded me─“the more, the merrier.” With only the slightest hint of disappointment on his face...
Oh, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Here to enjoy the festivities, are you?
Not me, of course! Why, I'm here on very important business─conducting market research to bring further fortune and profit to the boutique!
But I must say, this suit is simply the perfect combination of comfort and style. Perhaps I should have them mass-produced and add them to my lineup of wares...?
And here I thought Gridanians were all dour-faced gardeners and carpenters... Why, this festival could put even the masquerades back home to shame!
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>! Always a pleasure to see you! Enjoying the festivities, I take it?
What's that? You don't recognize me? You wound me, my friend! And after all we've been through together!

I must say... I had thought Gridanians to be all dour-faced gardeners and carpenters...but this festival could put even the masquerades back home to shame! If only my dearest Laniaitte could be here to enjoy it with me...
My Lord... I realize that you are undercover, but nevertheless─I must ask that you comport yourself in a manner befitting your lofty station.
Oho! Gridania's artisans have clearly outdone themselves with this year's decorations! I can feel the inspiration swelling up from the depths of my very soul!
Kweh, kweh!♪
Come one, come all! The passionate flames of Valentione's Day─vigorously stoked by none other than Bert the Beloved himself─roar brightly, eager to consume you!
Pray join us in contemplation during this most auspicious season of love. I, Rodrigault, shall be glad to provide all ailing hearts with sound and rational assistance.
Mwahaha...! The day is mine! To think I would find fellow goo enthusiasts here on Etheirys!
I do wonder what manner of mousse slime they're using. Yes, I simply must ask! Once all these people go away, at least...
Just my luck. Dragged off to this frivolous festival, and now I encounter you of all people.
And yet...a father cannot very well refuse his daughter's earnest plea.
Needless to say, you will say not a word of this to Severa or Valdeaulin. I would never hear the end of it...
Is it truly you!? Oh, I can hardly believe my fortune! It wasn't easy to convince Father to bring me here, but it was worth every little white lie and good deed!
Of course, we're not here simply for pleasure─we have an important missive from Werlyt to deliver to the Adders' Nest. But there's nothing wrong if we enjoy the season while we're here, yes?
More than anything, I want to share with everyone what a vast world of joy and merriment is out there! After all, what did we risk our lives for if not this?
Heh, you can't fool me. You're a cut above the amateurs I see around here. Why not challenge yourself, and see if you can make it halfway through the course blind?

Well I'll be, if it isn't an adventurer who looks perfectly happy to plunge headfirst into danger! Oh, come now, don't give me that look─I'm merely suggesting you take on the course blind, nothing more! ...Please?

I can guess by the look on your face: you're wondering why in the hells I'm standing around here, getting blasted by the sun with all this equipment on. Well, if you must know, I'm hoping to see an experienced adventurer take on the course in some exceedingly dangerous manner.

My, is it just lovely here with all of this wonderful shade. Tell that to the Roegadyn bloke over there, would you? Bet he wishes he had my “ridiculous” hat now. Anyway, don't mind me, I'm just looking out for a daring adventurer─one willing to challenge the course with a handicap, that is.

Ah, it's a pleasure to see you, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! I'm keeping an eye on things here while Themis seeks out further information in Elpis. Truth be told, there's not much to be done but hone my fledgling mastery of interment.
Hello, hello! The Moonfire Faire is here, and with a spicy returning attraction to bear! Should you wish to ignite the fire in your soul, pray make your way to Costa del Sol!
Have you come to enjoy the festivities? Oh, how exciting! I do hope you enjoy yourself!
I leave R'fhul Tia in your capable hands.
I took it upon myself to look out for R'fhul. Tried to teach him what I could, but clearly it wasn't enough. What he needed was a role model─you.

In the end, everything worked out, so I suppose all's well that ends well. Anyroad, I suggest you get back out there and enjoy the festival before I dampen the mood any further. I'll be here if you need me.
Looking to give the course a go, are we? Shouldn't be a problem for an adventurer like you─do enjoy yourself up there.
I overheard the quarrel from here─how unfortunate.

Hah! I had faith you would bring the matter with R'fhul to a neat and tidy end. With that settled, you can focus wholeheartedly on stunning onlookers as you perform one riveting feat after another in the Eorzean Nimble Warrior course!
You've done well to make it this far! Just a bit further, and you'll reach the end!
I appreciate what you did for R'fhul. Ashamed as I am to admit it, I can't help but wonder how I would have turned out if I'd had you as a mentor myself... Gods, I'm actually a little envious of him!

Congratulations, you've made it to the end...of the main course! If you're still hungry for more, we have the ultra-difficult dessert-er course─ahem, not its actual name─which takes you even higher up, assuming you have the stomach for it! Which very few do!
Ah, you made it back here again! I take it you enjoy this sort of thing? If that's the case, I recommend the most difficult course, which will take you even further up.
The end of one journey marks the beginning of another. For all those who continue to forge on in a world risen from the ashes, this humble minstrel would offer a song...
When I grow up, I'm gonna be an adventurer too, and then we can all challenge the course together! It's a promise, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>!
Hey, you made it just in time! We're about to make our first attempt, and could really use some pointers from our grandmentor!
I may still be just a novice, but the journey of every adventurer begins with a single step─and what better way to kick mine off than with a perilous obstacle course?
The three of us have decided to take on the challenge together. As their mentor, it's only right that I show off a bi─good heavens, don't glare at me like that! I've learned my lesson, really!
If I don't look familiar, it's because I recently joined the Students. I was impressed by the order's broad focus, and inspired by the way it rises up against threats.

For now, I serve as a humble liaison between our order and the Sons of Saint Coinach. While I'm still inexperienced, I'm determined to do my best, and hope to be entrusted with ever more important duties.
Tryin' our hand at delivery work is excitin', but sometimes I worry if we're cut out for it... Still, I said we'd do it, so we're doin' it! We'll pull through somehow─like we always do!

I think the key to happiness may be findin' a person who looks at you the same way Maru looks at our new kitchen. I can already tell the meals we make there are gonna be fresh, delicious, an' prepared with love!
Findin' those calves was lucky, but Ghasa's report on the local hippos has me uneasy... Argh! No way am I lettin' some no-good bandit intimidate us out of honest work!
This situation with Acala has me thin in the face. I just hope to the Sisters he's been makin' sure our hippo gets enough to eat...
I know I scolded Maru for it before, but ridin' that highroad was a hippo of another color! I can't wait till we hold another race!
Nice to see you, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! You always brighten my day.
Everyone's been workin' so hard lately, I think it's time to let loose an' host another race! I'm thinkin' of openin' participation to anyone with an interest─just to keep things interestin'!

I ain't sure about delivery work, but it's too late to slip the hippo harness now. The boss sure ain't the type to go back on anythin' she says, which... Well, I guess that's one thing we admire about her.

Shall I compare thee to a summer's tandoor? Thou art more lickerous and more tempting. Rough winds do─o-oh, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Sorry, I was just thinkin' about our new kitchen...

Cleanin' out that fishpond was no easy thing. Drainin' out the nasty water, scrubbin' the tiles, installin' a pump... I felt squeezed as juice by the end of it, but at least the little 'pots have a place to splash now.
I've only ever heard of Gajasura in stories, so it's hard to believe that they're on the island right now. But if someone as tough as Ogul takes such alarm, they must be worth our worry...
Knowin' the boss, I had a feelin' things were gonna turn out alright─but havin' Gajasura workin' peacefully alongside us? I guess miracles really do happen sometimes...
We Hippo Riders might be proud landowners now, but there's always somethin' to be done about the place. Give me a shout if you're ever in the neighborhood, eh? We always appreciate your help...
Don't you worry─I'm makin' sure all our hippos are well fed, well rested, an' highly pampered. Only the best for our precious 'potamuses!
Work difficult sometimes. But here, hippo carts. And good-taste food!
Battle brothers no more hungry. So, Acala try work. For battle brothers─Acala try hard!
Ain't nothin' I love more than a hippo, but Triple Triad is a close second! Come on, then─let's get this cart rollin'!
As appealin' as a game sounds, I've got this adorable hippo waitin' for me─you understand, right?
An' now you can say you've been bested by Svarna's hippo master. You're welcome!
Oooh, well played! I'll admit─you play Triple Triad almost as good as I ride!
Should've used my hippo cart card while I had the chance! I always can't bring myself to part with it... Let's play again sometime, eh?
Too close to call, eh? Then we're evenly matched─till I trounce you in our next game, that is!
In the course of liaising with the Sons of Saint Coinach, a scholar named Klynthota introduced me to a game called Triple Triad as a way to unwind.
If you have a free moment, would you care for a match?
It appears I've won! The Spinner must have seen fit to favor me!
It appears I've lost... Yours was a strategy blessed by the Scholar Himself. Most intriguing...
It appears we've drawn... I should like to call upon the Keeper to halt time and hold you here for another hand.
The Scions may have scattered to the four winds, but I still have plenty to keep me occupied!
Fear not─the mock Atomos will be ready soon enough. My fellow alchemists and I can stay awake for days at a time, if need be.
I am glad we were able to help you out, if only in a small way. Please, let me know should you wish to borrow the boat again!
I'm grateful to hear you've some time before you begin this expedition of yours. The Radiant Host will benefit greatly from Ser Estinien's martial instruction.
As fine as the lodging and meals were, I feel I may have sold my services too cheaply...
Our journey into the void promises to be neither short nor simple, yet I will persevere. I have kept my sister waiting for far, far too long...
Surely you hadn't expected me to sit around and sip tea while I let Nidhana do all the work?
Gods, is that you, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>!? It's so good to see you again!

Oh yes, my mother and I had it out after I returned. She believed studying sorcery was a waste of my talents─until I explained everything I learned during my time abroad. I now have her full support, and I couldn't have done it if not for you and Lady Ameliance!
I'm now working here at the High Crucible as an apprentice alchemist. It hasn't been easy, but I know it will all have been worth it when I've fulfilled my promise and made my dream a reality!
We're not quite open for business yet─but I assure you that our eggsquisite offerings will be well worth the wait!
Ah, I remember you. We met in Garlemald, yes? Fourchenault convinced us to come here to Sharlayan, but it's not at all what I expected.
Uncivilized is not quite the word for it, but they've not even trains for transit or radios for communication. There is much that needs to be improved here.

You're Fourchenault's acquaintance. <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>, was it? Life has certainly taken a turn for the better since coming here, and the people have taken quite an interest in magitek.
The others are wont to complain about this or that, but in truth, they're quite enamored with Sharlayan as well. We all share a common interest in the pursuit of knowledge.
My, what a surprise. Though I suppose it shouldn't be, considering all the Loporrits have told me. Speaking of whom, have they always been so...well...
At first I didn't know what to think. Between their peculiar sense of dress and ceaseless─yet surprisingly tasty─stockpile of carrots, I was worried we made a mistake.
They're a misguided sort, but I believe my fellows and I are up to the task of making substantial improvements to their facilities.
That a blasphemy should appear now of all times bodes ill for Garlemald. That said, I have faith we will find a way to fell the beast ere long.
With Lord Nerva gone, I daresay we have truly seen the end of the Empire.
The path forward for the people of Garlemald will not be easy, but I have no doubt they now walk the path to a better and brighter future.
Thank you again for answering our call for aid. I pray the matter can be resolved quickly, before anyone else succumbs to the blasphemy's influence.
Our plans to help the people form an interim government proceed apace.
A long and trying process, to be sure, but the benefits far outweigh the costs.
Ah, I thought I might see you here. We heard you'd come to assist the Alliance leaders with the blasphemy discovered here in Ilsabard.
Alisaie and I are doing what we can to help keep the people calm. I shudder to think what might happen were anyone to become one of those hideous beasts.
It's a relief to see you back in one piece. With the blasphemy gone, the people here can finally begin piecing their lives together.
Not an easy feat by any measure, but they are a resilient people. Even so, they're going to need help, which is why I plan to stay a while longer.
I don't know about you, but I've seen enough suffering and despair to last a lifetime. Needless to say, we'll do all we can to keep anyone else from turning.
Did Father really storm into the Tower of Babil alongside you?
I told him not to overexert himself, but he never listens. If he were anyone else, I'd give him a thick ear for being so reckless.
The next time you see him prepare to do anything rash, do be sure to call on me. I'll feel better knowing the both of us are there to keep an eye on him.
The people of Garlemald are fortunate to be in such good hands. Stay safe out there.
Ah, the mighty hero returns.
You can almost hear the world taking a collective sigh of relief with the blasphemies defeated. Still, it's no excuse for us to rest on our laurels.
We will remain diligent in our search for potential threats, and if any should arise, I hope we'll be able to call on you once more.
How lovely to have a visitor! Just in for a chat, or was there something more serious on your mind?
As I said, Khalzahl's colleagues are doing their best to carry on his legacy. I understand things have been hard without the man himself around to manage things.
And with so many of his business partners gone, besides... They do intend to keep calling it “Khalzahl's consortium,” though, which is nice, I thought.
Ah, I'd been meaning to thank you for speaking with Nashvan─I'm sure it meant a great deal to him.
He was a shell of a man after everything that happened, and it's good to see him find meaning in his life again.
Surviving, no matter how hard, is now a way for him to honor his son... The grief never goes away, of course, but would that we could all turn it into such strength.
ObjectParameter(1), ,1)>, do come in. Sit for a while, and tell me more of your time in Elpis.
Shall I send for some tea? Since their visit to Etheirys, the Loporrits have taken to brewing the beverage to serve along with “afternoon treats.”
I have no need of sustenance, of course, but I do recall Venat providing such things as we engaged in lengthy discourse. Continuing the custom seems appropriate somehow...
When you've finished with your treasure hunt, do come back and visit me. I think you'll be very interested in this request we've received.
Thank you for your assistance, charming adventurer! Ahem. By your stalwart support, the lovely Lisette, Has relinquished her post without any regret!
...From now on, it's Astrid's era. I can hardly wait to see the celebrations of ardor and affection she has in store for us.
My beloved is the daughter of aristocracy, whereas not a drop of noble blood runs through my veins.
It is for this reason, perhaps, that Astrid so disapproved of our union... But her insistence that Lisette and I enjoy this season together bodes happily for us, indeed!
Thank you for reminding me how important it is to stay true to oneself.
I feel so much more confident like this! For the sake of my sister's happiness and that of my own future, I will proudly carry out my duties as head emissary!

Ah, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. I was just reflecting on our time together in Sharlayan. 'Twas my first meeting with Ameliance in person, and your presence, though unexpected, was heartening.
She made quite an impression, I must say. Elegant, graceful, and with beauty matched perhaps only by her cunning. It is a rare sight to see Rowena outmaneuvered with such finesse.

I should have expected nothing less from the lady of House Leveilleur. Which reminds me, it has been far too long since last I spoke with Alphinaud and Alisaie. Mayhap, when time allows, I'll invite them for a spot of tea as well.
What? There ain't much we can do until his lordship is done pickin' apart the next passage o' his great-great-granddaddy's instructions.

If ye've no patience for waitin', might be as ye can ask yon Master Smallclothes to forge another type o' Manderville weapon. Not to worry: I'll be around to see it all comes together good an' proper-like.
Well, if it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Welcome to the Last Dregs! I'm afraid we're not open for business quite yet, but feel free to make yourself comfortable.
For all he calls me his “tormentor,” Osmon and I do work well together.
My herbal poultices soothe his book-weary eyes, and I benefit from his nigh-encyclopedic knowledge on...well, damn near everything. It's a symbiotic relationship!
Come to visit me in my doldrums, eh? Naught to do in such idle times but polish me pistol and dream of the day I get to use it again...
Aye, it'll come soon enough. And when it does, you'll be flyin' into danger right beside me─of that, I'm sure.
Not that you're one to gossip, but keep the particulars of Leofard's family between us, yes? Not even Radlia's got her hooks in that information.
Leofard may insist that mysteries make the man, but I find his failure to confide in us very boorish indeed!
It is said that mortal peril strips one of all pretense. Well, I plan to plunge the captain into danger so terrific, all his residual secrets shall be completely eradicated!
Now that the Raimille is up and flying, I need a new project to work on.
I was thinking something unusual─like a manacutter with a giant drill fixed to the prow! But whenever I mention it, someone always changes the subject...
I am dreadfully sorry, but you must first speak with my master before I can escort you.
Should you wish to visit my master's residence, it would be my pleasure to escort you.
Preparations for the marvelous masquerade are presently underway, but do come back soon!
The haunted manor is now accepting guests for the marvelous masquerade! Shall I escort you to the front door?
I can't say what's more unbelievable─that I'm gardening with the enemy, or that I quite enjoy it.
I was dead serious about the war, believe you me... Yet somehow, this feels more meaningful.
As do all individuals, we seek only to be part of something more. Yet we have come to consider that it is not perfect understanding we require─merely the shared experience of a pleasant meal.
Such pristine fish! We'll make sure to take good care of them─the ones we don't eat, anyway.
Is it possible that a substance that possesses no consciousness knows us better than we know ourselves?
Mayhap one day, fate shall see fit to reunite me with my faraway kin. A dragon can but dream...
Lest you wonder, I am quite content to watch the festivities from here. I have experienced enough transfiguration to last me a lifetime.
I was this close... This close!
Adventurer, back so soon? Trouble with capturing the clown, I take it?
Thank you for delivering smiles to all the sweet children of Gridania. I hope you will continue to help the professor spread joy this Starlight season!
Gwoooaaahhh!
You needn't worry about these voidsent. Not a one shall escape my sight.
Would you tell us of your recent ventures when you next return? I promise to make it worth your while.
\\<whirr> Ingredients may be submitted to this unit for processing.
Scanning Elysion and the Last Dregs for anomalies... All clear.
I am dreadfully sorry, but you must first speak with my master before I can escort you.
Last Dregs security protocol updated. Only rude intruders will be eliminated.
Welcome, welcome, welcome to the Last Dregs! ...Is that too much, do you think?
Flowers and fish... Perhaps we should recruit some carrot-loving patrons next.
The Ea are surprisingly attentive when it comes to the Miw Miisv. We haven't lost a one!
If more dragons are on their way, we're going to need bigger tables. One good sneeze and it's all over...
I've asked Stigma-4 to produce a refrigerant spray bottle in anticipation of the next time N-7000 gets on my nerves. Can't be too careful!
Business couldn't be better! We'll always have a table for you, though, so stop by any time!
Café and Elysion patrol─pardon, “rounds”─complete. This unit is taking its scheduled break.
\\<whirr> There is much data to be acquired from the Grebuloffs. If only they would stand still...
The Ea have yet to determine their preferences. This unit will continue projecting gastronomic data as necessary, even if some of it is...irregular.
\\<whirr> The Dragonstar was rich in natural resources. If they are reborn in Elysion, many more dragons may be tempted to the Last Dregs.

\\<whirr> Other units privy to recent logs have begun to request specialty beverages. This unit projects an increase in oil-related expenditures, but is looking forward to its civilization's further progress.

\\<whirr> Welcome, allied unit <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Are you here to process? Elysion's environs are peaceful today─or perhaps a barista unit can get you a cup of tea? This unit assures you there are no carrots in the tea.
Greetings! 'Tis I, Lisette de Valentione, here with passionate tidings for a season most amorous!
Does your heart ache with loneliness, or perhaps burn with unrequited longing? Forget your woes and come bathe in the sweet succor of our love!
In order to undertake the quest “Suited for Affection,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”
I must convince her...! I must...!
May the heavens shower felicity and love upon you, my good adventurer! Enjoy the festivities!
I should be glad to show you to the hydromantic terraces, if it please you.
Food for the mistress's consumption is kept in these cells. With the mistress devoured, we're free to help ourselves.
But the clever one is strong! Another warden went in to devour the clever one, but he hasn't come back out...
Though there's only the one dungeon here, we call it the fourth. The mistress's orders.
But the mistress is gone, and her orders with her. Rats can infest this castle for all I care!
Prey we caught are weakened in the dungeon before being served up to the mistress. “Tenderizing,” she called it, and that's the way she used to like it.
I can't survive without someone to give me aether. But where, oh where will I find a new master...?
I should be glad to show you to carcere IV, if it please you.
Grrr... Grrraaagggh!
Ahhh, my mistress... What must I do to bask in your sublime gaze once more?
You look tastier every time you walk by... \\<slurp> But I mustn't eat you... I mustn't eat you...
Without a master to rule us, it won't be long before we start preying on one another. And the weak are the first to be devoured. I must find someone strong to serve, and quickly...
Whose likeness is this, you ask? The hero who will save the world. I'm waiting for the day he comes. Or was it a she? I can't remember the details...
I don't know how long I've been waiting, or why I even wait. Could you be the hero, perhaps?
...No, I don't think so. Something tells me I'll know when I meet him. Or her. I'll just have to keep waiting.
Hmph, if it isn't a mortal. You remind me of the time I was summoned to your world by someone who sought beauty.
Well, it turned out to be a deviant who had my vessel chained to a bed. And when I tried to break free, he had the gall to call me a hideous fiend!
And as if that wasn't bad enough, he started slicing me up! I left that body and fled back here as quickly as I could. Never again, never again...
Farfarello warns me. That wasn't the true Barbariccia, he says. No, she's far more frightening! The scouring winds, the lashing hair... O-Oh gods, so much hair!
Interested in me, are you? Too bad, I'm not interested in you.
It's normal enough for newcomers to appear, but for her to bring them herself? That's never happened before. At least not in my time.
Mortals... Even the word has an irresistible ring. Just to hear it makes my stomach rumble...
Unnngh, I'm so hungry I might die... But I can't─not while someone's near.
You're not devouring my aether, you hear me? You're not devouring my aether!
Being new to the domain, I thought I should observe some formalities, like presenting myself to the mistress. But it seems no one cares about such things here. I like this place already.
Will you be setting sail for the vault?
Our next foray promises to be filled with even more danger. Pray leave Zero in my care for now, and focus on recovering your strength.
While we were exploring the void, I took the opportunity to record some data. Hopefully it will yield some useful information for our quest.
No sooner did we part ways than I was waylaid by the Radiant Host. I thought I had fulfilled my promise to train them, but apparently not...
The way the sky changes color with the passage of time... It's probably a mundane thing to you, but to me it's a marvel. I daresay I won't soon grow bored in this world.
So it seems voidsent can't be slain in their world. I shudder to imagine that being the case in ours as well...
Please come back safely! And bring a souvenir or two─for science!
It seems the clever one did for my fellow warden after all. I knew it was a bad idea to go in the cell...
Y-You did it, then? You defeated Barbariccia?
...That explains it. Why Farfarello has fallen silent. He's at peace now, and for both our sakes, I hope he stays that way.
Your account of the void has captured our imaginations, and we can barely sleep for all the possibilities racing through our minds! When you have a moment, we hope to hear more details from you!
A Triple Triad match? With me? I may not pose much of a challenge, but 'twould be my great pleasure to play against you, nonetheless!
The building of Triple Triad decks consumes my every spare thought of late. 'Tis a frustrating-yet-fascinating endeavor. Do you happen to dabble in the pastime yourself...?
Aha! The intoxicating thrill of victory! I must boast of this win to the other ladies-in-waiting. We've formed something of a card club, you see.
Ah, the bitter sting of defeat. I suppose card strategy must be a simple affair for one who has navigated the convoluted paths of the Sil'dihn waterways.
A draw? How unsatisfying. Hmm, I am not due back at the palace for a little while yet. Have you time for one more match?
While the gate remains open, we won't lower our guard even an ilm. Not a single voidsent will get past us.
While Professor Claudien is away, there is little to be done but compile our research. I'd ask you to help, but I'm well aware you have much greater tasks before you.
Lahabrea and Erichthonios are hard at work mending the wounds of keyward and creation alike. I wonder if their relationship, too, might be healed after this ordeal is done.
Why, if it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Are you that eager to see these dreary halls again?
I know not where you hail from, but I can't imagine you'd rather be here of all places...
At least I have Lahabrea for company, such as it is. We get along as well as can be expected. We even exchange words from time to time, even if just to discuss our work here. One step at a time, eh?
I find it difficult to guess at what Erichthonios is thinking, but when he is prepared to speak his mind, I shall be prepared to listen.
The appearance of Pandæmonium has sent ripples throughout the aetherial sea, which have been observed as far off as Thaumazein.
Though access to the Aitiascope has been temporarily restricted while the researchers go about their business, I'm sure exceptions can be made for one such as you.
Our time on the moon truly opened my eyes, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. And I mean to keep them open.
I know not what that Master PuPu is planning, but it falls to you and me to find out...
Yer an adventurer, ain't ye? Come on, then─lend us a hand for the Starlight Celebration!
They say that fancy Sharlayan bloke proved his theory or summat. Can't say I understand the particulars, but so long as he's makin' the children smile, he's got my blessin'!
I have a special range of goods on offer for our “odd job” contributors. The historic artifacts you are like to find are of far more interest to us than ordinary gil.
I've heard that Kokoshu is actually Her Grace's cousin. That certainly would explain their similar features...
Her Grace is eager to continue explorations of the Sil'dihn Subterrane. I am sure any offer to accompany the sultana will be immediately and joyously accepted!
Are you perchance...? Nay, I need to be sure.
That woman just now─for a moment I dared to hope she was the hero I've been waiting for. But then she left again...
Who was that woman!? She was even more beautiful than I am, if only slightly!
I must have escaped her notice because I have barely any aether left. Wonderful, I can continue dying a slow, excruciating death... Unnngh...
Two were devoured, you say? Well, as long as I wasn't one of them, I won't complain.
You're really going to fight her? I will pray for your victory. That way I won't get eaten.
So that was one of Golbez's archfiends. I would devour that aether in a heartbeat...except I'm liable to be devoured first.
No one comes and goes from this dungeon without permission. For you, though, I'll make an exception. Go on, go.
Woof! Grrrrrr...
Welcome to the apology issuance counter, and thank you for cooperating with our lottery fund reclamation efforts.

It appears there was a grievous clerical error which saw gil deposits mistakenly refunded to housing lottery winners. In recognition of those honest souls who return said gil, we are issuing bills of contrition in lieu of plot sale receipts.

The prices for these bills correspond to plot size and class, meaning you shouldn't be spending a single coin more or less than what your land originally cost. Unless of course you're buying a poster purely for ornamental purposes, in which case I won't judge your extraordinarily expensive taste in home decoration.
