Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,2)>. If you would follow me, I will show you to the guest chambers.
Apologies, but I've some work to do before the shop is ready for customers. Not long now, I hope...
I've always dreamed of a stage of my own... Well, not always─but always recently!
If I may... This uniform design is not what I would have chosen. Yet I must admit that the sense of camaraderie it offers is unparalleled.
Carats burning a hole in your pocket? I wager so. Feel free to peruse the fine─and fairly priced, if I do say so myself─wares we have in stock!
Are you here for a chat, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>? Tell me what's on your mind.
Magnificent, are they not!? ...That is to say, I hope you enjoy your visit to the machining station.
If you'd like some of the pudding, I suggest you order it now. One never knows when Puddingway will drop by...
Inventingway has truly surpassed himself with this moon-hopper! Even I cannot say what some of those buttons do...
Welcome to the Dreaming Workshop! \\<blip> \\<blip> \\<blip> ...Pardon, this is all terribly exciting.
Well, what do you know! It says “great fortune.” That bodes well for my voyage.
You're so lucky, Papa! I'll pray to Seiryu and ask him to give you lots of good fortune, too!

As mochi daikan, it is my duty to distribute festive rice cakes to our patrons...and our mochi stores can barely keep up with demand this Heavensturn! I take it your earnest endeavors are to thank for that, adventurer?
Let's see, according to this omikuji...good fortune is upon me!
Hm...“fair fortune,” is it? Well, I'll happily take that over the alternative.

When I heard that a celebration was to be held here in honor of me and mine, I wished to gaze upon its splendor with my own eyes... Byakko insisted I don this questionable attire, though he assured me that it would conceal my identity from unsuspecting mortals.
...Hm? A descendant of the maiden I spirited away now takes charge of this festival, you say? Most intriguing.

At the time, my intentions were not as benevolent as she believed─whisking her away was but a means to appease my misguided worshipers. And yet...that her tale should endure this long is a testament to her gratitude. Perhaps I should give my regards to this bugyo of which you speak.
The old city has long since sunk into the cold, chilly depths of Longmirror Lake, but up on the opposing cliffs, you can still find what's left of a certain shepherd's cottage.
Tee hee hee! Go on, royal sapling─if you've wings, fly forth and see!
The potential of blue magic is without limit, and I've no doubt you'll make the most of it.
So keep explorin', seek new knowledge, and show the world why they call you Azuro the Second!
Take good care of Anden III, won't you? I made him with oooh so much affection!
Though we leave Ryunosuke in your care, his younger brother Ryuji appears content to remain here and celebrate. 'Tis a joy to see him so fervently flapping about in his draconic attire.
May Ryunosuke serve you well, my friend. And may the blessings of the ryu be upon you always.

I be Mistbeard's right-hand man. Aye, I reckon that I am.♪
Fuddlin' me cap afore, sneakin' out the pub's back door.♪
Aaand nobody'll ever know.♪
O-Oh! <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! I was just singin' a little song, but I didn't mean nothin' by it, I swear! Just enjoyin' the melody is all...
With regards to communication, as the creature appears to understand our words, I believe I shall begin by teaching it letters. With some effort, I'm confident we'll be conversing ere long!
I will be on my best behavior until I've forged a pact. It's nothing short of a dream come true to be in this world, and I'll do whatever is required to remain!

Pray look around you, adventurer. Do you not see the peach blossoms in full bloom? The joyous smiles on the faces of all the townsfolk? Truly, there is no better time of year than the Little Ladies' Day celebrations!
You have my heartfelt gratitude for agreeing to assist Miss Aldiytha with her investigation, my friend. Together, I hope that you can uncover the origins of the fan.
To think the fan was part of a long-standing tradition of House Thorne... Goodness, I truly cannot thank you enough for lending Miss Aldiytha your aid!

As a result of your discoveries, we have been able to teach the Little Ladies' Dance to those in attendance, and as you can see for yourself, the celebrations look to be a resounding success because of it!
Ah, I hoped you would stop by, so that I might thank you properly. Had you not aided my daughter, we may never have bonded as we have now.
In truth, I did not realize how much joy it would bring me to see her take after her mother by inheriting our family's tradition.

And yet, I cannot help but worry that one day soon, she may meet the love of her life in much the same way I met her mother. I wish dearly for her to find such happiness, but I nevertheless find myself conflicted about the prospect of seeing her go...
The young mistress truly has a spring in her step during Little Ladies' Day celebrations. Why, I daresay one would scarce believe she suffers from a delicate constitution!
Why, hello there! The dreamy season of Hatching–tide is upon us once more.
We are still completing our preparations, but I hope you will join in the festivities once they commence!
The sylphs are more than welcome to participate if they would but cease their mischief-making... \\<sigh>
Just now, one of the participants made a point to speak with me, and who do you think was peeping out from that tonberry guise? A sylph!
The poor dear was very apologetic about raising such a fuss. Who can stay angry during a festival as felicitous as this?
The glory is ours! The realm shall finally recognize the true beauty of my most beautiful, precious tonberries! \\<snort> Oh, hello <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.

Fear not, brave tonberry─I shall remain ever vigilant for any signs of those marauding sylphs. If another caravan of eggs is plundered, I'll shuffle over with lightning speed and lend you that \\ special guise. Hee!
Finally, we can begin the festivities!
If it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! 'Tis ever good to see you, my friend. I trust you remain dedicated to your training?

We've come to Gridania for some training of our own, but thought it an excellent opportunity to partake in this year's Hatching-tide festivities. ...You can imagine my shock upon being handed this tonberry getup!
Still, if these celebrations can do aught to cultivate a positive image of tonberries, I am eager to help. Perhaps someday bounty hunters might even be persuaded to reconsider their marks.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! That we should meet again in the midst of a tonberry festival.
You must be surprised to see me wearing this, no? Hehehe! Alka was terribly worried I might take offense at the guises, but the love with which they were created is palpable.
Seeing so many step into a tonberry's robe with a smile on their face gives me hope that one day my compatriots might no longer suffer unjust prejudice.
Why, hello there, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. It warms this old woman's heart to see you well!

We're just on our way to examine the stelae and ruins of the Black Shroud. Our mammet friend continues to be quite the voracious reader of ancient languages, you know. Oh, it's been so long since I've done fieldwork, I feel as giddy as a first-year!
But I have to say, this tonberry masquerade is absolutely fascinating. Hah! I can't wait to brag to the Faculty of Anthropology─I daresay they'll be green with envy!
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>!? Oh dear, er─this isn't what it looks like!

We've come on an official matter, I assure you. There are certain relics in the Black Shroud we aim to investigate, and we only dropped by these festivities to refresh our minds before embarking on some truly rigorous and draining research.
...But you aren't troubled by such particulars, are you? \\<sigh> Deary me, I apologize. I'm so used to defending the validity of our research stipend that I'm afraid I prattled on. Pay me no mind!
Oh, it's you. What a peculiar locale for a reunion.

Originally, we were meant to be neck-deep in the translation of ancient texts by now, but instead we find ourselves trapped in a throng of tonberries. If there were but a way to rein in Professor Rurusha's reckless curiosity... \\<sigh>
Well, this is a most unexpected place to stumble into you, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>.
I was just preparing to leave on my next commission, when some fellow named Hamlyn sprang from the bushes and bullied me into this tonberry guise. Truly, we continue to live in exciting times...
Although, this sort of excitement is far preferable to others we've known. It is succor for the soul to watch people partake in such carefree merrymaking again.
When the Elder Seedseer bade us partake in these festivities, never could I have imagined it would necessitate assuming the guise of a tonberry.
However, as guardian of the Twelveswood, it is my duty to support our people's endeavors...no matter how bizarre.
Hatching-tide festivities have certainly evolved into a parade of peculiar attire. Even our sister once donned a rabbit suit for the occasion.
Although, I must say that this year's guises are by far the most peculiar I've yet seen. Tonberries! Who would have imagined?
Uuuh... This was a mistake, kupo─there's no room in here!
Guh! Pukni Pakk, are you alright, kupo?
...Pukni Pakk? P-Pukni Pakk, speak to me! Pukni Paaaaaaaaaaaaaaakk!
I must say, this tonberry suit may be the most daring fashion statement I've seen all season. I've been told that Hamlyn lad handcrafted each and every one.
His ability to convey passion through his pieces is quite remarkable. I daresay he possesses the sort of creative instinct that most artisans would trade their left hand for.
I came here for a peek at the latest fashion trends, but then out of nowhere, a complete stranger approached me and invited me to tea!
Of course, I only have eyes for one man and one man alone. But I do appreciate a hot beverage...
Oh, Yellow Moonberry, we're really in it now...
Kyaaa! The walking one from before!
This one wishes to apologize on behalf of other ones. Those ones didn't mean any...no, those ones did mean harm, but only because those ones were jealous ones!
Th-This one isn't here for mischief-making or egg-breaking! Promise! This one only wants to enjoy the festival with walking ones, so p-please don't tattle!
...I didn't expect to see you here, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. It feels like quite some time since we've met inside the city.
When the Elder Seedseer bade us partake in these festivities, never could I have imagined it would necessitate assuming the guise of a tonberry.
However, as guardian of the Twelveswood, it is my duty to support our people's endeavors...no matter how bizarre.
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! How good to see you. Have you come to celebrate as well?
Hatching-tide festivities have certainly evolved into a parade of peculiar attire. Even our sister once donned a rabbit suit for the occasion.
Although, I must say that this year's guises are by far the most peculiar I've yet seen. Tonberries! Who would have imagined?
Well, if it isn't <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. Come to partake in the sights, have you?
I must say, this tonberry suit may be the most daring fashion statement I've seen all season. I've been told that Hamlyn lad handcrafted each and every one.
His ability to convey passion through his pieces is quite remarkable. I daresay he possesses the sort of creative instinct that most artisans would trade their left hand for.

The sun burns bright, and that means the Moonfire Faire is come to offer respite! This year, the Sunshine Savior patrols the sands of Costa del Sol, ready to fight back anyone and anything that would dare to put a damper on the festivities.

I checked up on our guests, and lucky for us there wasn't a scratch in sight. Would've been much worse had that shark gained even an ilm of purchase, but thanks to Lyonell, all that's left of that beast are the stories people tell of the savior's bravery.
I reckon you're proud to call yourself an honorary Sunshine Savior, but we've got Lyonell to protect us from now on. Go on and enjoy yourself for once!
The others have safely arrived! Dare I hope that this is all of me now...?
Rest assured that the ingredients and materials entrusted to me for safekeeping are kept safe as you please. ...How safe do you please, by the by?
Oh, come now, you really needn't worry about me. I meant it when I said that I would strive with you to the last.
So go on─tend to your own duties, and let us meet again when the investigation resumes.
You know, I can't help but wonder why Deryk came to us for help. As an explorer, didn't he want to keep the glory of discovery for himself?
I, for one, would have gone over the phantom realm with a fine-toothed comb alone before thinking to tell a single soul!
It was a brave and selfless thing that engineer did, piloting the snowcraft for our sake.
There's something to be learned from such tenacity. I imagine it's how they've managed to persevere despite all that's happened here.
With the gate closed, we need no longer worry about voidsent. For the moment, at least. The soldiers and refugees have done well to protect what remains of their home thus far.
And we will help make sure they continue to do so. I have no doubt you will see Vrtra reunited with his sister, but we will be praying for your success all the same.
I've no intention to pry, but it seems Zero is quite unaccustomed to the kindness of strangers. She reminds me of myself when we first met.
Distrustful of outsiders. Hateful, even. Unwilling to believe anyone would offer anything without some manner of exchange.
I know not how or why she found herself willing to go to such lengths on our behalf, but I have no doubt now you and your comrades will be better for her company.
Though I long to rush to my sister's side, I also understand now is not the time for action. I must rest, and prepare. As should you.
Since being in your company, I cannot help but feel I've changed somehow...
The world does not appear as it did when I first arrived. Nor, I suspect, would the void were I to return. It is a strange, though not unpleasant, feeling.
It is only a matter of time before we make our way back to the void, and take the fight to Golbez. However strong he may be, I've no doubt he will rue the day he crossed paths with us.
Ah, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>. I'm afraid you've come too soon─my research has yet to yield fruit.
But rest assured I will find a way. To secure a means to traverse the rift to other worlds, and put an end to Golbez's scheme.
As much as I'd like to return home, it wouldn't feel right without anything to show for all the time we've spent here. Which is why I think I'll stay just a little while longer.
I've been thinkin' about what I can do to make life better for the refugees, and teachin' them what I know of magitek seems as fine a place as any to start.
Even if it means they eventually have no need of me, it would be a relief to know they can survive on their own.
Panic in times of crisis will only create further crisis. For the refugees' sake, we have to maintain calm and order.
I thought to take my daughter on a short stroll, but the soldiers tell me it's too dangerous at present. Not that I'm in any rush, mind. We have nothing but time.
The situation here changes every day. Thankfully, for the better. Indeed, it feels an altogether different place from when we first arrived.
My time here has proven a heartening reminder that, despite what tragedy befalls us, there will ever be allies we may turn to for aid.
If you should see anyone wandering about outside of Tertium, please see them back to camp at once.
Even should we find voidsent have arrived at our door, to try and move our patients as they are is too great a risk. We've no choice but to secure their safety here.
Why does it have to be so bloody cold on the days I choose to go and help the Ist Legion?
I suppose knowing my work is appreciated makes it worth it in the end.
A horde of voidsent!? But I've just returned to camp─I'm exhausted! What I wouldn't give for but a single day of peace and quiet.
I cannot deny the supplies provided by the contingent have been a great help, but it would be unwise to grow reliant on their kindness.
If we're to replenish our reserves, we must exercise restraint and carefully manage what few resources we have.
If these voidsent should cut off the contingent's supply route, I fear our present stores will not last long...
We're not allowed outside until the voidsent threat is dealt with, but I have faith the situation will turn in our favor before long.
If only I had but sent a few of our men to keep guard of Alzadaal's Legacy... How is Varshahn to find his sister now?
The stone formation there to the north is known as Khadga. A most frightful ball of flame was seen hurtling in its direction not long ago.
There's been no discernable change in the waters off the coast since the explosion. That our scouts have yet to report back is a growing cause for concern, though...

As I was gazing out at the ocean, my ruminations were interrupted by the appearance of a most curious light. B-But it is nothing to worry about, surely. I must keep calm. Keep calm, and remember the teachings...
Wh-What was that strange light out on the waters? Do you think we should call back our boats?
Sisters be praised! The ocean waters are calm and quiet once more. We would do well not to squander this good fortune.

Even now I struggle to believe Alzadaal's Legacy and its voidgate are no more. But fear not─we will find a way back to the void for you. We still have the work of House Daemir to guide our research, after all.
Thankfully the quake wasn't so terrible as to cause any cave-ins.
The work we do is hard, and certainly not without risk, but we do our best to keep workers safe and in good spirits.
That quake earlier was quite the fright. Made me wonder how effective our emergency plans would really be if we're too exhausted from working to escape.
You say a what was up there!? Thank the gods none of us thought to go and investigate.
Let's see, according to this omikuji...good fortune is upon me!
Now, as I recall, there are other minor fortunes in addition to this one. They should be written here somewhere...

Aha! Here we are─“Relationships: Treasure thy closest comrade.”
A fine fortune, but which comrade does it speak of, exactly? I suppose it can't hurt to show them all a little extra appreciation, but...
Hm...“fair fortune,” is it? Well, I'll happily take that over the alternative.
But I shudder to think what will happen if I make the same mistakes I did last Heavensturn. If I'm to properly understand this fortune, I must thoroughly read through each section.

Here's one. “Relationships: Treasure thy closest comrade.”
That should be simple enough...but who might this “comrade” be? Perhaps I should ask Beaudefoin for his insight.
Ye heard his lordship: we're bein' left to our own devices till he's tracked down the next installment o' that musty ol' Manderville manual.
Unless yer lookin' to improve another weapon? Go an' talk to Master Smallclothes─at least that'll give us summat useful to do.
We'll make these tools so bloody grand, they'll be passed down for generations. Can't be callin' 'em “splendorous” if they don't live up to the name, eh?
Am I really working on a project with the Master Grenoldt and the actual Warrior of Darkness!? This is everything I ever wanted, and I'll give it everything I have!

Mistress Mowen is always solicitous of her business connections, but there seems to be something special about this one. As such, I will be sure to anticipate your material needs, and keep the shelves adequately stocked.
Alphinaud told me about the gate you found in Lapis Manalis. Hopefully that means the end to our voidsent troubles.
I did not press for details, but he gave me the impression you met with some misfortune out there. We don't have much, but never forget we're here to help if you need it.

What think you of this ongoing case, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>? The inspector, at least, seems confident that the piece of starship we found will help pin down the whereabouts of PuPu's comrade.
If and when it does, I need to be there with quill and parchment in hand. We need to be there. As I've said before, this battle for truth cannot be fought by one man alone.

So the ball of flame was a voidsent? Well, thank the gods you were here to do away with it. Though the danger seems to have passed, I think I'll keep watch of the coast a while longer. Just to be safe...
So the enemy's objective was to destroy the treasure vault.
It is most unfortunate we could not protect Alzadaal's Legacy, but I dare not think what might have happened had they set their sights elsewhere.
That was a fine display! And while fun is the order of the day, you might find fulfillment in a bit of challenge. We have courses prepared that're fit for the nimblest of the nimble!

You're familiar with Triple Triad, yes? ...Oh, what am I saying? Of course you are! Everyone on Etheirys knows about it, or so I'm told. A friend of mine who went there taught me how to play, and now my dream is to be in a tournament one day! So...would you like to play a round with me!?
I-I won? ...I won! Perhaps I really could join a tournament if I put my mind to it! Many, many thanks for the match!
Oh, dear... It seems you beat me fair and square! Still, this was a wonderful learning experience. I suppose I'll have to keep practicing if I truly want to play with the professionals!
Well, paint me orange and call me a carrot! We have a draw! But we can't simply leave it at that... If you'd like a rematch, just say the word, because I would love one!
One might think standing around and waiting for something fun to happen isn't particularly entertaining, but I beg to differ. Why, I have plenty of fun just being in a place this lively!
Terribly sorry, but I'm afraid we're not yet open for business. Please check back again later!
Do you think my feelings reached them? The distance is so great...
Such unfettered creativity... Inventingway truly is an example to us all!
Have you tried Cookingway's cuisine yet? My favorite is the carrot cake. And the carrot muffins. And...
One of the Ways at our imaging station has even painted his uniform! It warms my heart to see them expressing themselves so colorfully.
Given the success of our first broadcast, not-Counselingway has agreed to continue hosting on a regular basis. They're also training others in the ways of radio!
<split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! Welcome, welcome! Do take a turn at any station you like.
Did that fight with the mammet really awaken some new craftin' instinct...? Part o' me reckons his lordship is havin' a laugh, but ye can't deny the results.
I am working tirelessly to see Inventingway's creations put to use...but no luck yet, I'm afraid.
The cooking station dishes I have sampled thus far have all exceeded my expectations. Have you tried the frozen beverages? I cannot rate them highly enough.
I am glad that the imaging station has been such a success. I had Buildingway prepare a contingency plan in case of the worst, but I do prefer to keep that wall where it is...

The broadcasting station has brought our remaining wayward Ways back into the fluffle, so I think it's fair to call this project a success. Of course, we never could have accomplished our goals without your stellar performance!
Dreamingway has begun to ask about yet more stations. While you may be tempted to acquiesce, I must direct your attention to the entirely full hold before us...
My dream is to stand out─in green! How do I look? Please say “green”...
Well met, ally of Ronka. I trust my brother Gilltet─Anden, rather─has not caused you further trouble?
As blithe and feckless as he may be at times, he is a kind and doting brother.
I would be grateful if you called upon him from time to time. A sister can't help but worry, after all.
The research team at Eureka Orthos has tasked me with guiding you to the Eight Sentinels. If you're ready to set off, simply say the word.
I cannot help but wonder if there is a living descendant of Tenzen somewhere in the world. For so long I thought him lost to us, but if a part of him endures in another...I would be glad.
We are all fated to one day die, and when my time comes, I hope to see my beloved again. But until then, I shall live each day to the fullest.
Perhaps I might begin by visiting the Umineko Teahouse in Kugane, and filling my stomach to the brim with mitarashi dango.
We neglected to mention this earlier, but only those chosen by the Phoenix Blade may wield it.

To be clear, we were relatively confident that the sword would not reject you as unworthy, but it nevertheless gladdens me to see that we were right. Particularly since the rejection can be most ungentle.
You recall that we invited Gyodo here to remunerate him for aiding us in finding Isshu, yes? When Senri greeted him upon his arrival, he screamed “It's a trap!” and promptly fainted.
We put him and his koban on a ferry and sent them back to Kugane. Why a talking catfish should be afraid of a talking cat is beyond me.

Ever since the affair with Isshu, the Four Lords have acknowledged my potential the slightest bit more. Indeed, my training has evolved from divining wasabi–filled tako–yaki to divining wasabi–filled sushi.
Lord Godbert is a truly exceptional craftsman. If I am to follow in his footsteps, I must demonstrate the same discipline, sacrifice, and willingness to limit my wardrobe to the bare essentials.
I am hopelessly enamored of Master Gerolt's extraordinary smithing skills. Such remarkable talent and focus. Mayhap if I began shaving my head...

I can guess by the look on your face: you're wondering why in the hells I'm standing around here, getting blasted by the sun with all this equipment on. Well, if you must know, I'm hoping to see an experienced adventurer take on the course in some exceedingly dangerous manner.
Heh, you can't fool me. You're a cut above the amateurs I see around here. Why not challenge yourself, and see if you can make it halfway through the course blind?

My, is it just lovely here with all of this wonderful shade. Tell that to the Roegadyn bloke over there, would you? Bet he wishes he had my “ridiculous” hat now. Anyway, don't mind me, I'm just looking out for a daring adventurer─one willing to challenge the course with a handicap, that is.

Well I'll be, if it isn't an adventurer who looks perfectly happy to plunge headfirst into danger! Oh, come now, don't give me that look─I'm merely suggesting you take on the course blind, nothing more! ...Please?
Have you found time to meet with Alphinaud and Alisaie? They have done much to earn the trust of citizens and soldiers both in the short time they've been here.
I think it is because they refuse to paint the people of Garlemald with a single, broad brush.
What's more, they have proven their intentions through both word and deed, working side by side with the Garleans as equals. Their compassion is nothing short of exemplary.
As our plans for rebuilding begin to take shape, more and more people have been inspired to help.
Of course, even when we no longer work under the auspices of the Ilsabard contingent, life here will never be as it once was.
As you well know, the Empire's prosperity came at the expense of other nations. But I should like to think all understand the way forward must be found working with our neighbors, not against them.
All is clear on these festive shores!
Of course, we have you to thank for this peaceful reprieve. But now stewardship of the Moonfire Faire falls to me!
I will stand vigilant, day and night. I promise to make you proud, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>!
Your aid in quelling the fell mononoke of Mount Rokkon is truly appreciated, but pray be mindful of your own safety. Certain tales of your exploits are rather concerning...
It has been years since I last paid visit to Kugane. It remains...crowded.
I trust our feast at the inn has put sufficient spring in your step to propel you up Mount Rokkon.
Few have a deeper appreciation of your derring-do than I. Otherwise, I should never have entrusted you with my life during our explorations.
The eagerness with which you hurl yourself at even the most fearsome of mononoke does give me pause, however. Have care that you do not grace Thal's halls before your time.
Do ye know if the meyhane puts vegetable juice in their spirits? I swear I could taste carrot...
What're ye still lurkin' around for? I can't fancy up yer weapon again till his lordship says he's ready.
Or is it a different weapon yer lookin' to improve? If that's the case, go bother Master Smallclothes an' I'll lend a hand when it's needed.
Lord Godbert and Master Gerolt are living legends in their respective professions. What incredible fortune that I should have the honor to learn from them both.

Too many children in this town have been orphaned by the tragedies of war. And though naught will ever fill the void left by my loved ones, I wish to watch over these young souls, and see them grow up into fine men and women.
I have kept myself busy assisting Gaius with the establishment of Werlyt's forces of late. It is hard, but fulfilling work.
"Freedom through Technology“... That's the Ironworks' motto, yes? It makes me wish I'd met them sooner.
One day, I hope to grow closer with the children─perhaps even become something akin to family. Do you think that could happen?
The first order of our forces will be to patrol the highroads and ensure they are safe to travel. In time, perhaps we can reestablish overland trade routes with Ala Mhigo.

It is no surprise the children have come to see the G-Savior as a symbol of hope. For them, it is more than a machine─it is the hero which saved them from the clutches of the Empire─along with yourself, of course.
Little by little, the people of Werlyt are regaining a sense of normalcy in their lives. We of the Resistance intend to provide what aid we may as they continue to rebuild.
Despite joining the Ironworks, Avilina refuses to wear the uniform. Perhaps like Nero, a red one would better suit her tastes?
Life will never be the same, but I am doing my best to move forward. I know that's what my husband would have wanted me to do.
With each day new challenges arise, but as long as I have my family, I am happy.
I am truly grateful for the many friends I have made in my time serving here.
It ain't easy, puttin' yer name on tools that the whole bleedin' world will see...but every great smitty bears that responsibility one day or another, an' Miss Chora-Zoi's no different.
\\<sigh> I should've known there was summat strange about that purple carrot juice when me life started flashin' before me eyes... Ah, well. No use dwellin' on it.
I must put forth every effort towards my work... Not only for ourselves, but for all those in Eulmore who will benefit from it as well!

I'm relieved that our project's been so successful, though I do worry for Master Grenoldt and Mistress Mowen... If one were to, say, draft up an ideal environment for one's superiors to confess their undying affection for one another, would that still count as work?
To all who follow their hearts, I offer my hopes in song. Wheresoever your journeys may lead you, may you find happiness upon your path...
I can only imagine what Martyn is up to in Limsa, but you'll look after him, won't you?
The Arcanists' Guild? He wasn't offering more of his private lessons again, was he? Given the opportunity to flaunt his knowledge, the man simply can't help himself.
Martyn said he has a good feeling about Gridania. I certainly hope he's right.
I heard Martyn was actually after a bounty, is that right? Somehow I'm not surprised.
He wasn't ruffling any feathers at the stables, was he? Surely not...
You were absolutely brilliant, <split(<String>ObjectParameter(1)</String>, ,1)>! I can scarcely remember the last time the Celestium was so lively.
Ah, the many melodies I hear on my travels throughout these lands. As a musician, I feel compelled to commit their notes to parchment that they might be shared with interested audiences...
Still waiting on Lord Godbert, I see.
If you're looking for the inspector, he's chasing down a lead on that apothecary who was helping PuPu's comrade.
As for myself, I'm closing in on the last details for my big exposé. I shall let you know when it's time to tear away the veil.
Rest assured I do not intend to remain idle. I shall try to discern the nature of this sphere and ensure that no other similar phenomenon has appeared elsewhere.
Professor Claudien is inside that? Oh, I do hope he's okay...
What brings you here, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? I sense you may have lost your way...

Well, I'm back to my days of fetching documents and assisting with various other errands. While I'm glad that Professor Claudien is back safe and sound, a short vacation would have been much appreciated...

Erichthonios is attending to his tasks deeper within the facility, while Master Lahabrea and Master Elidibus have left to the surface. They have much more pressing duties than to oversee our reconstruction.
They all seemed quite certain that they would see you again. From what I know of your relationship, I have no doubt that fate agrees.
Compiling equipment inventory... Cross-referencing safety data...
Allied unit's participation is...unexpected. Recalculating advisability of free-for-all...
Might I ask your opinion on the “Hyper Hustle” broadcast? The radio aficionado community is abuzz with debate.
Did such fantastical events truly transpire? Are the Loporrits trying to pull one over on us? What is a “Grebuloff”? I cannot say for certain, but I do know that everyone else is wrong.
Greetings, allied unit. Preparations for production of a racing Omega unit are well underway.
Would you like a cup of carrot coffee over which to contemplate your inevitable vanquishment?
Slowly but surely, the Garlean people are regaining their feet.
Even as we speak, Lord Mettius and his fellows are busy drafting laws pertaining to the use of the Tower of Babil.
'Tis an important step towards ensuring Garlemald's continued independence, and you played no small part in making it possible.
So long as the Garlean people need help, we'll be here to lend it.
I'm happy to say there was no incident of note after we channeled aether from the tower. The people held up fine.
We'll continue keeping an eye on things here, so you just focus on your own task in the void.
While I labor for Garlemald's future, Zero fights for her own home... Be they near or far, it's nice having friends who share similar goals with you.
I will relay the particulars of your endeavor to members of the contingent. Rest assured we will do our best to assist you.
An equitable arrangement... The satrap of Radz-at-Han indeed has a vision for the future.
Given their long lives, mayhap dragons are well suited to formulating long-term policy. Ishgard might benefit from having one in an advisory capacity.
'Tis well that the Garlean people have the chance to stand on their own two feet. Until they complete the transition, the contingent will continue to lend what aid it may.
If truth be told, had you approached us with your petition earlier, we are like to have declined it. The situation was simply too precarious.
But the people have begun to pull themselves up, and I dare to hope they will lend an ear to your words.
We still face a veritable mountain of decisions to make, but make them we shall.
Including the understanding we have just reached, each and every one will shape and secure the future of Garlemald. This I firmly believe.
If we're going to be trading with other nations, I reckon more than a few of us would be keen to get in on it. It'd be a living, and I can respect those who want to make it work.
Just when I thought I'd take a walk... No matter where I go, I'm in the shadow of that damned tower.
So in the end they're going to activate the tower. But if it means we'll have a better chance...well, I'll be damned if I let everyone's sacrifice be for nothing.
Until now, we've gotten by on provisions provided by the Ilsabard contingent. But if we can engage in trade of our own, we'll be able to do more than just survive.
I used to be a technician in the imperial army. If sharing our technology and expertise with other nations would benefit our people, then I'd be more than willing to cooperate!
We only want to survive. To be given the chance to rebuild, that our people might stand on their own again one day...
Trading with others would mean opening a market, wouldn't it? A lively, bustling market, with foods from foreign lands.
I know it's not as simple as saying it, but we have to believe that we'll know prosperity again one day. That's what gives us hope, isn't it?
When my daughter is well enough to travel, I am contemplating working in Radz–at–Han. I want nothing more than to show her the world...
If we trade with other nations, we would be able to obtain medical supplies by ourselves. We wouldn't need to rely on charity.
If the use of magitek proliferates as the technology spreads to other nations, the demand for ceruleum will likewise increase.
If all goes well, some of us may find new opportunities─and purpose.
Who are you?
I've heard from the magistrates. We retain control over the tower, and grant access to it in exchange for foreign currency.
With sufficient funds, we would be able to wean ourselves off our dependence on the Ilsabard contingent. It will be a fine thing to look after our own again.
I haven't seen you before. I assume you have permission to be here.
I don't know much about this trade agreement, but our leaders seem to have high hopes for it.
So I'll trust in them, and focus on my own duty─protecting the people as I always have.
I was originally stationed outside to keep watch for threats, but now that any errant warmachina will be dealt with, I've been reassigned to security inside the station.
To be honest, I couldn't be more relieved. I wasn't sure how much more my body could take, standing out there in the cold day after day.
Oh, it's you! I must thank you for intervening in my altercation with the contingent's envoy earlier. I realize I was unduly stubborn, concerned only with obeying orders.

One of the benefits of this decision is that fewer soldiers like me and my brother need stand watch outside in the freezing cold. For that, I am truly grateful.
Come to see how we fare, have you? You needn't have troubled yourself so.

As young Jullus reminded me, we are the chain that connects generations past and future. Rather than clinging to our nation's past triumphs, I am determined to do only what is best for our people in the here and now.
While we did not ask for it, Garlemald is home to a gateway to the moon. It is my belief that this unique facility should be used for peace.

For the foreseeable future, we will lease the tower to the Ilsabard contingent, who will occupy it in the capacity of caretakers. And lest you wonder, you are free to use it as you please─it's the least we can do after all you have done for us.

We used every last bit of our alchemical expertise to ensure the brands would endure for as long as possible, so please set your mind at ease and focus on rescuing Master Vrtra's sister!
Truth be told, I didn't think this plan for a harmonious All Saints' Wake would ever work. But I'm glad to be proven wrong!
You really enjoyed those cookies, didn't you? I'll make another batch as soon as I can!
All Saints' Wake is come again... What wickedness is in store for us this year?
I'll continue to keep a close eye on the pumpkin-headed woman and her minions. Pray enjoy the festivities to your heart's content.
